Name: Coptic textile
Description: A fragment of textile in wool and linen. The motif consists of a continuous formal plant design in green, yellow and white on a rose ground within a formal border. The garment may originally have been yellow.Technique: plain weave ground. Tapestry with built up shapes, curved weft, slits and 'soumak'.Ends per inch (warp threads): 34 over ground, 17 over tapestry.Picks per inch (weft threads): 160 approximately.
